subject: Nutrition
title: Victory Gardens
description: A fast breakdown of Victory Gardens for builders.

hook.text: During WWII, 20 million Americans grew home gardens producing 40% of the nation's vegetables.

buildup.text: Victory gardens were promoted as patrioticâ€”growing your own food freed supply for troops overseas.

discovery.text: The campaign worked so well that commercial produce was redirected almost entirely to the military.

twist.text: After the war, gardens disappeared. Suburban lawns replaced productive food plots within a decade.

climax.text: Victory gardens proved communities can feed themselves when motivatedâ€”and forget how when peace returns.

punchline.text: A wartime solution became a peacetime memory.

quiz.question: What percentage of U.S. vegetables came from victory gardens?
